revised_title: The Measurement of Heat-Loss Rate at Body Temperature by Convection, Radiation, and Evaporation
tldr: The authors investigate the rate of heat loss at body temperature through convection, radiation, and evaporation using the kata-thermometer, an instrument designed for this purpose. They explore the effects of varying atmospheric conditions, wind velocity, and barometric pressure on the rate of cooling and evaporation, providing a method to measure the relative rates of heat loss under different conditions.
